events.title: UT – Open Level –  I Had the Heart – One-of-a-kind tango experience with Oliver Kolker
events.description:
Oliver Kolker @ Ultimate Tango – May 2-3-4

Join us for a one-of-a-kind tango experience with Oliver Kolker, an internationally acclaimed tango dancer, performer, and film director. Over the course of three days, immerse yourself in tango’s rich artistry through film, conversation, workshops, and dance.

MORE INFO: https://www.ultimatetango.com/kolker

Ticket Price:

  • 200$ Best Deal: Full Experience Pass (All 4 Workshops + Movie Night + Milonga)
  • 40$ 05/02 Full Evening Package (Movie + Q&A +Milonga)
  • 25$ 05/02 Movie Night + Q&A with Oliver Kolker
  • 20$ 05/02 Milonga Only
  • 50$ 05/03-04 any 1 workshop
  • 90$ 05/03-04 any 2 workshops
  • 135$ 05/03-04 -any 3 workshops
  • 180$ 05/03-04 -all 4 workshops
  • 150$ – 05/03 at 10am private lesson (60min)
  • 150$ – 05/03 at 4pm private lesson (60min)
  • 150$ – 05/03 at 5pm private lesson (60min)
  • 150$ – 05/03 at 6pm private lesson (60min)

categories.name: Milonga
categories.description: Milonga typically are evening based, have a dress code, and no 'lessons' on the floor. Newbies may watch, but may have a hard time participating. Solid dance techniques and floor management is expected to attend.

organizer.description:
Don’t Repeat Mindlessly. Learn Through Understanding.

Here, at Ultimate Tango you will find all you need to become a true member of the Tango community in Boston MA and worldwide. We focus on developing in you the true understanding of what Tango is. Argentine Tango is not just a dance. It’s a philosophy.  A way of comprehending the world. A way of building relationships Indeed, a way of understanding yourself.

Ultimate Tango, the Premier Boston tango studio,  has been helping Boston, MA residents master the art of the tango in exciting ways. We take pride in being the premier Boston, MA tango studio and working with students of all ages and skill levels.

events.title: Academy: Absolute Beginner Class + Social
events.description:
Join us every third Wednesday of the month for a community night of Tango at Peka Restaurant! Argentine Tango is meant to be a social activity- this not only means dance, it also means friends, music, food and a glass of good wine. Please join us for a social evening at Peka Restaurant where you can enjoy all of these things together.

This event is meant to welcome EVERYONE. Join us for an absolute beginner class before hand, and then stay to keep dancing, or just to socialize.

6:00 – 7:00 \\ Absolute Beginner Class

7:30 – 10:00 \\ Tango Social (Dancing, Eating + Drinking with friends!)

$20 – Entrance + 1 drink

PEKA RESTAURANT 304 Washington St., Brighton, MA 02315

Reserve a table: 617 – 817 – 0382

categories.name: Milonga
categories.description: Milonga typically are evening based, have a dress code, and no 'lessons' on the floor. Newbies may watch, but may have a hard time participating. Solid dance techniques and floor management is expected to attend.

organizer.description:
Fernanda Ghi
Fernanda Ghi is a true legend in the world of Argentine Tango. Celebrated for her elegant style, unique interpretation, creative choreography and powerful command of the stage, she has toured internationally for over two decades.

Ghi performed in countless shows and exhibitions, and became the World Argentine Tango Champion IDO in 1999. She and and her partner were the first non-Asians ever invited to perform at the Imperial Theater in Tokyo and were the feature dancers on the PBS special ‘Tango Magic’ with Pablo Ziegler and the Orpheus Orchestra. Ghi has performed in concert with several Symphony Orchestras (New Mexico, Long Beach, Costa Mesa) and was commissioned the creation of a tango ballet for the Tulsa Ballet Dance Company. In 2017 and 2018, Ghi served as a judge at the ‘Tango Mundial,’ the World Competition for Argentine Tango.

Ghi is the founder of the Fernanda Ghi Dance Company which creates a fusion between Argentine Tango and other art forms, such a theater, visual arts, opera and other styles of dance. The Boston Tango Academy is founded around Ghi’s pedagogy. The Academy provides training for professional and amateur dancers, and is the premier location to learn authentic Argentine Tango in the Boston metro area.

Mia Dalgish
Mia is a professional Argentine tango dancer and co-manages The Tango Academy of Boston. She teaches private lessons, group classes and workshops for students of all levels. Mia sees Tango as a way of being and a dance. Her approach to teaching is to create a clear and consistent understanding of body mechanics. Since 2010, Mia has trained with her mentor, Fernanda Ghi. From 2012 – 2019, she was the Manager and an Instructor at Artango Dance School, founded by Fernanda Ghi and + Guillermo Merlo.

Mia has 15 years of experience in production and curation for both visual and movement arts. Since 2010, Mia has been a Co- Curator at Pictura, a renowned fine art gallery for contemporary photography. In 2015 Mia co-founded Hybridmotion a contemporary dance theatre company. As a Director + Dramaturg, Mia focused on the story-telling element of the company’s work. She was instrumental in developing and conveying the concepts, emotions, and aesthetics of projects. These projects included the creation of full length shows for the stage, as well as working with clients such as HBO, Netflix and the Boston Pops Orchestra. She served as a Co-Artistic Director until 2022 and now consults on various projects.

events.title: Wednesday Tango Break– 7pm Beginner Tango Classes
events.description:
The Tango Society of Boston sponsors Mid-week Tango Dance breaks every Wednesday — Boston’s largest informal Milonga (Tango social dance) and Tango lessons.

Features a lesson in Argentine Tango for Beginning to intermediate dancers (and open to newcomers). No prior experience or partner required.

tags.name: Beginner

venue.description: Home of The Tango Society of Boston Events.

organizer.description:
Who Are We?

The Tango Society of Boston was incorporated in June 1997 as a Massachusetts non-profit organization dedicated to the support and growth of the Argentine Tango. Within 5 months, it already had 250 members, and the numbers are growing weekly! While there are many facets to the Argentine Tango—the music and the culture being among the most prominent—it is the dance that brings most of us together.
The Tango is a social and participant’s dance and is for everyone to learn and enjoy, regardless of dance background!

Our membership has people from all walks of life, and has probably 20 or more countries represented! !

What Do We Do?

We are not just a paper organization! Our numerous activities fall into two broad categories:

1. Planning Tango events

Weekly Wednesday evening Tango dances at 16 Bow St, Union Sq, Somerville open to all, with a 1-hour lesson at the beginning
Weekend Tango seminars several times a year with the best Tango teachers in the world (usually from Argentina), such as the one with the renowned Pablo Veron, Fernanda Ghi and Guillermo Merlo, Daniela Arcuri, Hector Falcon, to name a few.
Milongas (Tango dance socials), some with live music
Special and unusual Tango events such as outdoor “Tango by Moonlight” nights in summer
Our Annual Boston Tango Festival in June

2. Supporting the growth of the Tango community

We sponsor TangoLine™, a 24-hour Tango hotline publicizing events for all Tango organizers in the Boston area–
try it at 617-699-OCHO (-6246)
Support local Tango organizers, musicians, etc., through our events, affiliations, and publicity and information channels
Outreach efforts via newspaper, radio and TV publicity
Joint events with other local and regional art and cultural institutions, both commercial and non-profit (e.g., Museum of Fine Arts, First Night Boston, movie houses showing Tango-related films, Tango festivals, etc.)

events.title: Wednesday Tango Break– 8pm Intermediate Tango Classes
events.description:
WELCOME FEBRUARY–THE MONTH OF LOVE AND FRIENDSHIP!!

The Tango Society of Boston sponsors Mid-week Tango Dance breaks every Wednesday — Boston’s largest informal Milonga (Tango social dance) and Tango lessons.

Features a lesson in Argentine Tango for Beginning to intermediate dancers (and open to newcomers). No prior experience or partner required.

Schedule
7:00-8:00: Beginners Tango with Guillermo Merlo. This class is for beginners and those wishing to brush up some new techniques.
8:00-9:00: Adv-Intermediate Tango Class with Guillermo Merlo –Theme changes every month

This month, the Intermediate+ class wilL work on:
“GANCHOS INTERNOS”. (Inside Ganchos)
“Ganchos Internos” “inside hooks” are movements where one of the partner’s legs hooks around or behind the partner’s leg in a fluid and coordinated manner.
These Ganchos can be done by both the leader and the follower, to create a dynamic and expressive connection during the dance. They are also used to add variety and embellishments to the dance as well as to communicate emotions and sensations during the dance
Because Ganchos Internos require good control of balance, posture and embrace technique to ensure they are performed safely and harmoniously, Maestro Guillermo will review and emphasize the correct techniques to practice to achieve this.
𝑪𝒐𝒎𝒆 𝒋𝒐𝒊𝒏 𝒖𝒔 𝒇𝒐𝒓 𝑪𝒍𝒂𝒔𝒔𝒆𝒔 𝒂𝒏𝒅 𝒅𝒂𝒏𝒄𝒊𝒏𝒈 with 𝑮𝒖𝒊𝒍𝒍𝒆𝒓𝒎𝒐 𝑴𝒆𝒓𝒍𝒐 this week and for the month of February.

9𝙥𝙢-12𝙖𝙢 – 𝘿𝙖𝙣𝙘𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙬𝙞𝙩𝙝 𝙜𝙪𝙚𝙨𝙩
𝑨𝒍𝒍 𝑪𝒍𝒂𝒔𝒔𝒆𝒔 𝒂𝒓𝒆 $20 𝒆𝒂𝒄𝒉 𝒇𝒐𝒓 𝒃𝒆𝒈𝒊𝒏𝒏𝒆𝒓 𝒂𝒏𝒅 𝑰𝒏𝒕𝒆𝒓𝒎𝒆𝒅𝒊𝒂𝒕𝒆.

4 𝒄𝒍𝒂𝒔𝒔𝒆𝒔 = $70 — regular price
𝑨𝑫𝑫𝑰𝑻𝑰𝑶𝑵𝑨𝑳 𝑷𝑹𝑰𝑪𝑬 𝑭𝑶𝑹 𝑴𝑰𝑳𝑶𝑵𝑮𝑨:

𝑺𝑷𝑬𝑪𝑰𝑨𝑳: $10 𝒊𝒇 𝒚𝒐𝒖 𝒂𝒓𝒆 𝒕𝒂𝒌𝒊𝒏𝒈 𝒕𝒉𝒆 𝒄𝒍𝒂𝒔𝒔𝒆𝒔 ***𝑺𝑻𝑼𝑫𝑬𝑵𝑻 𝑫𝑰𝑺𝑪𝑶𝑼𝑵𝑻 𝑭𝑶𝑹 𝑫𝑨𝑵𝑪𝑰𝑵𝑮 𝑶𝑵𝑳𝒀
7-8𝒑𝒎 — 𝑩𝑬𝑮𝑰𝑵𝑵𝑬𝑹;
𝑻𝒉𝒆 𝑩𝒂𝒔𝒊𝒄 𝑻𝒂𝒏𝒈𝒐 𝑺𝒕𝒆𝒑𝒔 𝑰𝒇 𝒚𝒐𝒖 𝒉𝒂𝒗𝒆 𝒏𝒆𝒗𝒆𝒓 𝒕𝒂𝒌𝒆𝒏 𝒂 𝑻𝒂𝒏𝒈𝒐 𝒄𝒍𝒂𝒔𝒔, 𝒕𝒉𝒊𝒔 𝒊𝒔 𝒇𝒐𝒓 𝒚𝒐𝒖. 𝒀𝒐𝒖 𝒘𝒊𝒍𝒍 𝒃𝒆 𝒂𝒃𝒍𝒆 𝒕𝒐 𝒂𝒄𝒕𝒖𝒂𝒍𝒍𝒚 𝒈𝒆𝒕 𝒐𝒏 𝒕𝒉𝒆 𝒅𝒂𝒏𝒄𝒆 𝒇𝒍𝒐𝒐𝒓 𝒂𝒏𝒅 𝒔𝒉𝒐𝒘 𝒚𝒐𝒖𝒓 𝒇𝒓𝒊𝒆𝒏𝒅𝒔 𝒉𝒐𝒘 𝒕𝒐 𝑻𝒂𝒏𝒈𝒐!! 𝑨𝒏𝒅—𝒆𝒗𝒆𝒓𝒚𝒐𝒏𝒆 𝒏𝒆𝒆𝒅𝒔 𝒂 𝒍𝒊𝒕𝒕𝒍𝒆 ‘𝒃𝒆𝒈𝒊𝒏𝒏𝒆𝒓 𝒄𝒍𝒂𝒔𝒔’ 𝒊𝒏 𝒕𝒉𝒆𝒊𝒓 𝒍𝒊𝒗𝒆𝒔—𝒆𝒗𝒆𝒏 𝒕𝒉𝒐𝒔𝒆 𝒘𝒉𝒐 𝒂𝒓𝒆 𝒂𝒍𝒓𝒆𝒂𝒅𝒚 𝑻𝒂𝒏𝒈𝒐 𝒂𝒅𝒅𝒊𝒄𝒕𝒔.
8-9𝒑𝒎 — 𝑰𝑵𝑻𝑬𝑹𝑴𝑬𝑫𝑰𝑨𝑻𝑬 + 𝑻𝒂𝒏𝒈𝒐–
” Ganchos Internos” — see description above
9:00𝒑𝒎-12:00𝒂𝒎—𝑫𝒂𝒏𝒄𝒊𝒏𝒈
𝑮𝒖𝒆𝒔t DJ: TOSHI
𝑫𝒂𝒏𝒄𝒊𝒏𝒈 𝒊𝒔: $15/𝒑𝒆𝒓𝒔𝒐𝒏 –𝒊𝒇 𝒚𝒐𝒖 𝒂𝒓𝒆 𝒏𝒐𝒕 𝒕𝒂𝒌𝒊𝒏𝒈 𝒄𝒍𝒂𝒔𝒔𝒆𝒔
$10 𝒔𝒕𝒖𝒅𝒆𝒏𝒕𝒔
𝑺𝑷𝑬𝑪𝑰𝑨𝑳: $10 𝒊𝒇 𝒚𝒐𝒖 𝒂𝒓𝒆 𝒕𝒂𝒌𝒊𝒏𝒈 𝒕𝒉𝒆 𝒄𝒍𝒂𝒔𝒔𝒆𝒔 ***𝑺𝑻𝑼𝑫𝑬𝑵𝑻 𝑫𝑰𝑺𝑪𝑶𝑼𝑵𝑻 𝑭𝑶𝑹 𝑫𝑨𝑵𝑪𝑰𝑵𝑮 𝑶𝑵𝑳𝒀

MILONGA PASS: $50 –only to be used on Wednesdays
In order to get the full benefit of our classes, we recommend that you advantage of one of the packages. However, drop in are welcome.
Class card is not refundable and must be used within the month it is bought.

PAYMENT ONLINE:
Cash
Checks
Venmo: @danceunionstudio
You can purchase a Milonga Pass and get a discount!
No need to worry about carrying cash all the time when you can carry your milonga pass!

categories.name: Progressive Class
categories.description: Each week adds to the previous weeks lessons

venue.description: Home of The Tango Society of Boston Events.

organizer.description:
Who Are We?

The Tango Society of Boston was incorporated in June 1997 as a Massachusetts non-profit organization dedicated to the support and growth of the Argentine Tango. Within 5 months, it already had 250 members, and the numbers are growing weekly! While there are many facets to the Argentine Tango—the music and the culture being among the most prominent—it is the dance that brings most of us together.
The Tango is a social and participant’s dance and is for everyone to learn and enjoy, regardless of dance background!

Our membership has people from all walks of life, and has probably 20 or more countries represented! !

What Do We Do?

We are not just a paper organization! Our numerous activities fall into two broad categories:

1. Planning Tango events

Weekly Wednesday evening Tango dances at 16 Bow St, Union Sq, Somerville open to all, with a 1-hour lesson at the beginning
Weekend Tango seminars several times a year with the best Tango teachers in the world (usually from Argentina), such as the one with the renowned Pablo Veron, Fernanda Ghi and Guillermo Merlo, Daniela Arcuri, Hector Falcon, to name a few.
Milongas (Tango dance socials), some with live music
Special and unusual Tango events such as outdoor “Tango by Moonlight” nights in summer
Our Annual Boston Tango Festival in June

2. Supporting the growth of the Tango community

We sponsor TangoLine™, a 24-hour Tango hotline publicizing events for all Tango organizers in the Boston area–
try it at 617-699-OCHO (-6246)
Support local Tango organizers, musicians, etc., through our events, affiliations, and publicity and information channels
Outreach efforts via newspaper, radio and TV publicity
Joint events with other local and regional art and cultural institutions, both commercial and non-profit (e.g., Museum of Fine Arts, First Night Boston, movie houses showing Tango-related films, Tango festivals, etc.)

events.title: Wednesday Tango Break  –Dancing
events.description:
The Tango Society of Boston sponsors Mid-week Tango Dance breaks every Wednesday. Boston’s largest informal Milonga (Tango social dance).

9:00-12:00 (Midnight) Social Dance Break Milonga. Tango dancing till 12 Midnight.
Guest DJ’s every week.

Features a lesson in Argentine Tango for Beginning to intermediate dancers (and open to newcomers). No prior experience or partner required.

Schedule
7:00-8:00: Beginners Tango with Guillermo Merlo. This class is for beginners and those wishing to brush up some new techniques.
8:00-9:00: Adv-Intermediate Tango Class with Guillermo Merlo –Theme changes every month

**See other posting for Tango Classes information.

Call Vicky if you have any questions at 617-721-4872

More information; www.bostontango.org

categories.name: Milonga
categories.description: Milonga typically are evening based, have a dress code, and no 'lessons' on the floor. Newbies may watch, but may have a hard time participating. Solid dance techniques and floor management is expected to attend.
